headline: This Week In AI Chips - AI Powers Shift In-Car Experience Through Strategic Partnerships
summary: Recent developments in the AI chip industry highlight significant advancements in in-car AI experiences, as Cerence, NVIDIA, and Microsoft deepen their collaboration. Cerence xUI, a hybrid, agentic AI platform, now leverages NVIDIA AI Enterprise and runs on Microsoft Azure, garnering strong traction with automakers worldwide. This partnership aims to meet the demand for natural, in-car experiences powered by large language models, with multiple global automakers set to deploy these solutions...

headline: AI ‘Fatigue’ Leaves Investors Focused on S&P’s Other 493 Stocks
summary: A growing number of investors are now wagering that run, led by the Magnificent Seven, is about to end.  Mounting concerns about AI’s ability to deliver seismic changes on the American economy — and the fat profits that would come with them — has turned investor euphoria about the technology into agita.  “I call it ‘AI fatigue,’” said Ed Yardeni, president and chief investment strategist at the eponymous Yardeni Research.

content.title: AI ‘Fatigue’ Leaves Investors Focused on S&P’s Other 493 Stocks
content.summary: A growing number of investors are now wagering that run, led by the Magnificent Seven, is about to end.  Mounting concerns about AI’s ability to deliver seismic changes on the American economy — and the fat profits that would come with them — has turned investor euphoria about the technology into agita.  “I call it ‘AI fatigue,’” said Ed Yardeni, president and chief investment strategist at the eponymous Yardeni Research.

headline: Wall Street's hot start to the year cools as stocks drift
summary: Discovery rose 0.7%, while Paramount Skydance slipped 0.7% and Netflix edged up by 0.6%. In the oil market, crude prices fell after President Donald Trump said that Venezuela would provide 30 million to 50 million barrels of oil to the United States. A barrel of benchmark U.S. crude dropped 1.5% to $56.24.

A barrel of benchmark U.S. crude dropped 1.5% to $56.24.

headline: Can Retirees Count on JEPQs 10.4% Dividend and Monthly Payments?
summary: JPMorgan Nasdaq Equity Premium Income ETF (NYSEARCA:JEPQ) offers retirees an 11.5% dividend yield with monthly distributions through a covered call strategy on Nasdaq-100 holdings rather than traditional dividend payouts. The ETF holds mega-cap tech stocks like NVIDIA (NASDAQ:NVDA) (7.78%), Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL) (6.76%), and Microsoft (NASDAQ:MSFT) (6.25%), then systematically sells call options on these positions. headline: Alphabet Surpasses Apple in Market Cap for First Time Since 2019
summary: Alphabet shares were up 1.6% in midday trading, giving it a market value of $3.864 trillion.  Apple  dipped 0.3%, reducing its market cap to $3.861 trillion.  Wednesday marked the first time Alphabet had a greater market value than Apple since Jan. 29, 2019, according to Dow Jones Market Data.

content.title: Alphabet Surpasses Apple in Market Cap for First Time Since 2019
content.summary: Alphabet shares were up 1.6% in midday trading, giving it a market value of $3.864 trillion.  Apple  dipped 0.3%, reducing its market cap to $3.861 trillion.  Wednesday marked the first time Alphabet had a greater market value than Apple since Jan. 29, 2019, according to Dow Jones Market Data.

headline: S&P 500 Edges Higher After Latest Updates on the Economy
summary: The S&P 500 keeps struggling to stay above breakeven as Wall Street digests the latest double-dose of data.  The Nasdaq Composite, which has lagged the Dow so far this year, was leading the pack with a 0.6% gain.  Health care, consumer discretionary, tech, and communication services were leading the S&P 500.
